greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Sum_{n>=1} 1/A000032(2*n).
comment: c = (1/4)*(theta_3( (3-sqrt(5))/2 )^2 - 1 ), where theta_3(q) = 1 + 2*Sum_{n >= 1} q^n^2. See Borwein and Borwein, Proposition 3.5 (i), p. 91. Cf. A056854.
Compare with Sum_{n >= 1} 1/(L(2*n) - sqrt(5)) = phi and Sum_{n >= 1} 1/(L(2*n) + sqrt(5)) = 2 - phi, where phi = (sqrt(5) + 1)/2. - _Peter Bala_, Nov 23 2019
This constant is transcendental (Duverney et al., 1997). - _Amiram Eldar_, Oct 30 2020
reference: J. M. Borwein and P. B. Borwein, Pi and the AGM, Wiley, 1987, p. 91.
link: Daniel Duverney, Keiji Nishioka, Kumiko Nishioka and Iekata Shiokawa, Transcendence of Rogers-Ramanujan continued fraction and reciprocal sums of Fibonacci numbers, Proceedings of the Japan Academy, Series A, Mathematical Sciences, Vol. 73, No. 7 (1997), pp. 140-142.
mathematica: First[ RealDigits[ N[(EllipticTheta[3, 0, GoldenRatio^(-2)]^2 - 1)/4, 120], 10, 105]](* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 07 2012, after _Eric W. Weisstein_ *)
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_, Dec 25 2008
